briefTitle: Pulmonary Edema Resolution in Severe Preeclampsia and Eclampsia
officialTitle: SeveriTy of Pulmonary Edema and Timing of Resolution in Patients With Severe Pre-eclampsia and Eclampsia (TIPER): A Physiological and Sonographic Prospective Observational Study

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

\- All patients with severe pre-eclampsia or eclampsia admitted to hospital Princess Christian Maternity Hospital

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients with chronic hypertensive disorders
* Lung ultrasound not feasible, e.g., due to electricity breakdown, or absence of the trained sonographer or presence of subcutaneous emphysema,

primary.measure: Frequency of LUS consistent with pulmonary edema
primary.description: Frequency endpoint: proportion of patients with a LUS positive for pulmonary edema Severity: LUS aeration score
primary.timeFrame: during hospital stay, average of 1 month

primary.description:
Categorical: Fraction of patients with improvement or resolution of LUS findings.

Numerical: delta LUS score between T1 and T2
primary.timeFrame: during hospital stay, average of 1 month

secondary.measure: Frequency of acute respiratory failure in patients with Severe Pre eclampsia and in patients with Eclampsia
secondary.description: Proportion of patients with acute respiratory failure
secondary.timeFrame: during hospital stay, average of 1 month

secondary.description:
Proportion of patients with

* consolidations
* isolated pleural effusion
* minor LUS findings
secondary.timeFrame: during hospital stay, average of 1 month

secondary.description: Fraction of patients that receive oxygen and/or CPAP (Continuous Positive Airway Pressure) and/or mechanical ventilation
secondary.timeFrame: during hospital stay, average of 1 month

secondary.measure: Frequency of patients with abnormal cardiac function
secondary.description: Defined as low cardiac index measured by ultrasound
secondary.timeFrame: during hospital stay, average of 1 month

secondary.description: SpO2 (peripheral capillary oxygen saturation) to FiO2 (fraction of inspired oxygen) ratio
secondary.timeFrame: during hospital stay, average of 1 month

secondary.measure: Frequency of Major Direct Obstetric Complications (MDOCs)
secondary.description: Fraction of patients with at least one additional MDOC (antepartum hemorrhage, postpartum hemorrhage, sepsis, uterine rupture, obstructed labour)
secondary.timeFrame: during hospital stay, average of 1 month

secondary.description: Fraction of patients with at least one among stroke, severe malaria, acute kidney injury and cardiac insufficiency.
secondary.timeFrame: during hospital stay, average of 1 month

secondary.description: Intra uterine fetal death (IUFD), Apgar score, Admission to special care baby unit (SCBU)
secondary.timeFrame: during hospital stay, average of 1 month
